com.ibm.avatar.algebra.datamodel

Class FieldType

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.avatar.algebra.datamodel.FieldType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<FieldType>

    public class FieldType
extends Object
implements Comparable<FieldType>
    This class encapsulates the data type of a field in a Tuple object. This class is mostly a container for constants. In particular, it contains FieldType constants for all the supported scalar data types.

        public static final FieldType SPANTEXT_TYPE
        A Span or Text field.

      • NULL_TYPE

        public static final FieldType NULL_TYPE
        A Null object field. Used to represent the type of a clearly unknown object.

      • UNKNOWN_TYPE

        @Deprecated
public static final FieldType UNKNOWN_TYPE
        Deprecated. As of v3.0.1. Use NULL_TYPE instead.
        Placeholder for an unknown type, used during the early stages of compilation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FieldType

        public FieldType(AbstractTupleSchema reftype,
                 boolean isLocator)
        Constructor for table types (i.e. function parameters defined by "table (...) [as locator]")
        Parameters:
        reftype - type of the tuples represented by this field type
        isLocator - true if the tuples are represented as a locator (pointer); false if they are directly embedded

      • FieldType

        public FieldType(FieldType t)
        Copy constructor. Copies all fields.
        Parameters:
        t - type to duplicate

        @Deprecated
public boolean getIsStringType()
        Deprecated. As of v3.0.1, this method is deprecated. Use getIsText() instead.
        Returns:
        true if this is exactly the String type (or the universal null type)

      • getIsBooleanType

        public boolean getIsBooleanType()
        Returns:
        true if this is exactly the Boolean type (or the universal null type)

      • getIsScalarType

        public boolean getIsScalarType()
        Returns:
        true if this field is of a scalar (atomic) type, as opposed to a list or table locator

      • getSourceDocType

        public FieldType getSourceDocType()
        Returns:
        For Span types, the type of the document that was the source for the span's target. For Text types, the type of the document that was the source for the text. Returns null for other types or if the text isn't derived.

      • setSourceDocType

        public void setSourceDocType(FieldType type)
        Parameters:
        type - For Span types, the type of the document that was the source for the span's target. For Text types, the type of the document that was the source for the text.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • accepts

        public boolean accepts(FieldType actualType)
        Determines if the given actual type can be used as our type, possibly after a conversion.

        Note: This method does NOT commute. Invert the arguments and you will get a slightly different answer in certain cases.

        Parameters:
        actualType - another FieldType object
        Returns:
        true if a field of type otherType can be used in function calls and extraction operators that expect a field of the current object's type

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:

      • comparePtrs

        public static boolean comparePtrs(Object o1,
                                  Object o2)
        Utility method to compare the values of two pointers, either of which may possibly be null.
        Parameters:
        o1 - first object to compare (may be null)
        o2 - second object to compare (may also be null)

      • compareComparablePtrs

        public static <T> int compareComparablePtrs(Comparable<T> o1,
                                            Comparable<T> o2)
        Utility method to compare the values of two pointers to Comparables, either of which may possibly be null.
        Parameters:
        o1 - first object to compare; if not null, must be an instance of T, in addition to being Comparable
        o2 - second object to compare

      • convert

        public Object convert(Object val)
        Automatic type conversion. Currently only available conversion is between Span and Text.
        Parameters:
        val - The input object to be converted
        Returns:
        The converted object of this FieldType
        Throws:
        InterruptedException

      • checkType

        public boolean checkType(Object val)
        Method to verify the given val is of correct type. This is intended for test code that validates the type system itself.
        Parameters:
        val - The input object the type of which is to be checked
        Returns:
        true or false, indicating if val is of the correct type

      • comparableTo

        public boolean comparableTo(FieldType other)
        Check whether two types are comparable for equality.

        This is a precondition to guard against internal inconsistency.

        Parameters:
        other - The other object to be compared against.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether the objects are comparable.
